Information.Subtext: Ethernet Status
Power Status
Select whether to query the CAM prior to decryption to ensure that the program can be decrypted or not.
Select whether to automatically reset the CAM if it is not decrypting.

Select whether the Common Interface List Management should add and delete individual programs or update all programs when the list changes. Updating all programs will cause temporary loss of service for all programs when another is being modified.

Attempt to Auto Recover CAM from descrambling failure by resending CA_PMT Clear and CA_PMT Update. Disabling this option will result in Host ignoring descrambling failure detections. If user wants CAM to be reset, CI CAM Auto Reset option must be enabled.
Select whether to restrict decryption to only the transport specified by Transport Stream ID and Original Network ID.
If decryption is to be restricted to a specified transport, set the Transport Stream ID.
If decryption is to be restricted to a specified transport, set the Original Network Identifier.
Select whether to use the CAM to decrypt the entire transport stream, or only the PIDs being used by the active services.

Displays the latest alarms and faults that the device has generated internally.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
The name of the fault.
First time a specific fault was set on the system.
The type of the fault, it can be either a warning or an alarm.
Text details about the fault, support information to identify the issue will be present here.
Displays the temperature information received from the Environmental Characteristics and Controls (ECC) system.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
The slot number of the chassis where the sensor is located.
The row number of the chassis where the sensor is located.
The chassis card's acronym.
The board name where the sensor is present.
The internal location ID of the sensor.
The sensor's name, helps identify the type of information being read.
The value read by the sensor.
Concatenation of card and slot fields.
The internal order ID.
Displays the voltage information received from the Environmental Characteristics and Controls (ECC) system.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
The slot number of the chassis where the sensor is located.
The row number of the chassis where the sensor is located.
The chassis card's acronym.
The board name where the sensor is present.
The internal location ID of the sensor.
The sensor's name, helps identify the type of information being read.
The value read by the sensor.
Concatenation of card and slot fields.
The internal order ID.
Displays the fan information received from the Environmental Characteristics and Controls (ECC) system.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.

The row number of the chassis where the sensor is located.

The value read by the sensor.

The internal order ID.

Information.Text: Environmental Characteristics and Controls Temperatures Other Data
Information.Subtext: Displays the all the non-classified ECC information received from the Environmental Characteristics and Controls (ECC) system.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
The slot number of the chassis where the sensor is located.
The row number of the chassis where the sensor is located.
The chassis card's acronym.
The board name where the sensor is present.
The internal location ID of the sensor.
The sensor's name, helps identify the type of information being read.
The value read by the sensor.
Concatenation of card and slot fields.
The internal order ID.
Contains the status for all the radio frequency units available in the system.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
The card where the RF unit is located.
The port where the RF unit is located.
The multi input path stream ID, associated with the RF unit. If not specified, the default value should be 1.
The downlink frequency of the RF unit.
The number of symbols per second currently being received by the RF unit.
The FEC inner code rate used by the RF unit. Possible values: Auto 1/2 2/3 3/4 5/6 7/8 8/9

The modulation type being used by the RF unit. The following modulations are possible:
> N/A > DVB-S > DVB-S2 > QPSK DVB-S > QPSK DVB-S2 > 8PSK DVB-S2 > 16APSK DVB-S2 > 32APSK DVB-S2 > QPSK DVB-S2X > 8PSK DVB-S2X > 16APSK DVB-S2X > 32APSK DVB-S2X
The rolloff factor of the incoming signal. Possible values: Auto .20 .25 .35

Shows the input signal's spectrum inversion setting, which allows the operator to track and select inverted and non-inverted digital signals.
Possible values: Auto Normal Opposite

Shows the LNB's power supply settings. A 13V indicates a vertical polarization, while 18V is an horizontal polarization. The Horizontal and Vertical NIT modes indicate that the polarization is decided by the Polarization parameter.
Indicates whether or not the 22 kHz tone signal is available to be sent or not on the RF unit.
Shows the lower local oscillator frequency of the LNB.

Shows the higher local oscillator frequency of the LNB. If the LNB is using a single band oscillator, this value should be zero. If the value is above zero, then it should also be above the value of LO1.

Shows the internal threshold frequency used for selecting the LO1 or LO2 frequency, depending on the current downlink frequency settings. This option is only used in dual-band LNB applications. In a single-band LNB applications, this value should be 0.0.
Determines the type of polarization used, when the Horizontal or Vertical NIT options are chosen on the LNB Power Mode parameter.
Displays the orbital position of the satellite, in degrees (East or West). To be used with the East/West Flag parameter.
The flag that shows the direction of the satellite's orbital position.

Shows the frequency range used to automatically maintain a tuning of the RF signal to the desired frequency (0 to +/- 5 MHz). This range indicates both higher and lower limit.
The default value is +/- 3 MHz, which is ideal for operation above 10 Ms/s. However, for low symbol rate operation, it's recommend to use a value of +/- 1 MHz or less.

Shows how the program specific information is obtained.
Basic requires NIT (Network Information Table) to be present.
Auto uses all the available service list tables and it will acquire if any table is present.
Custom must define the custom tuning parameters.

Shows whether there's an input signal locked or not by the system. A lock can be acquired on a carrier without valid content, which is considered a lock without signal. When the carrier has valid content, it will be considered locked with signal.
Indicates the bit rate of the input signal.
Indicates the name assigned to the network.

Indicates the network ID of the uplink signal the receiver is to receive when using the selected preset. The network ID of the receiver must match the network ID associated with the transmitted signal that identifies the NIT (Network Information Table) to be used.
Displays the transport ID number.
Shows the code about how the tuning parameters were last saved.
Indicates how the tuning parameters were last saved.
Indicates whether tuning is using the NIT (Network Information Table) to tune to other transports, or whether tuning is forced to use the user selected parameters

Determines which tables are required for tuning. Rigorous requires all service list tables to be present to acquire the signal. Relaxed requires any service list table to be present to acquire the signal.
Indicates whether the BAT is being used to create the service list.
Indicates whether the NIT is being used to create the service list.
Indicates whether the SDT is being used to create the service list.
Indicates whether the PAT is being used to create the service list.
Shows the strength of the received signal level.

Param.Name: RfUnitsStatusTableCarrierToNoiseRatio
Param.Description: Carrier to Noise Ratio (RF Units Status)

Information.Subtext: Indicates the signal to noise ratio on the received signal. Can be empty if no lock is obtained on a signal.

Param.Name: RfUnitsStatusTableCarrierToNoiseMargin
Param.Description: Carrier to Noise Margin (RF Units Status)

Information.Subtext: Indicates how much the carrier to noise ratio is above the noise threshold. Can be empty if no lock is obtained on a signal.

Shows whether the input signal is being properly received or not. Possible values are: > Locked - Indicates the receiver is locked to a carrier with no valid content.
> Lock+Sig - Indicates the receiver is locked to a carrier with valid content.
> No Lock - Indicates the receiver is not locked to a carrier.

Indicates the Link Marin for RF1, this parameter is used in a Mediation Driver.
Indicates the signal level of the received signal, in dBm for RF1, this parameter is used in a Mediation Driver.
Indicates the signal to noise ratio on the received signal.
Shows whether there's an input signal locked or not by the system on RF1, this parameter is used in the Mediation Driver.

The status of all video decode output fields
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.

Indicates the video encoding, format, and resolution of the received program (MPEG1, MPEG2, or H264 format with a resolution of: SD480i/2997, SD480i/3000, SD576i/2500,HD720p/5000, HD720p/5994, HD720p/6000, HD1080i/2500, HD1080i/2997, HD1080i/3000, UHD, Unknown or Unsupported).
Shows the video format chosen for PV output streams.

Param.Name: VideoDecodeStatusSDVideoOutputFormat
Param.Description: SD Video Output Format (Video Decode Status)

Information.Subtext: Shows the SD format used for video output. Values can be: Auto, NTSC, PAL-N (AR), PAL-M, or PAL-B/G/I/D. You must use NTSC for 525-line systems and PAL-B/G/I/D for 625-line systems.

Param.Name: VideoDecodeStatusSDVideoOutputFormat
Param.Description: SD Video Output Format (Video Decode Status)

Information.Subtext: Indicates the bit rate of the received video stream.

Indicates whether the 3:2 pulldown is detected (yes) was recently detected (recent) or not detected (no) in the input video stream.
3:2 pulldown converts 24 fps video into 29.97fps video.
Indicates the frame rate of the input video stream. Values can be_ 25.0, 29.97, 30.0, 50.0, 59.94, 60.0, unknown, or unsupported.
Shows the type of synchronization used. Can be manual or automatic.
Shows the encoding standard used on the stream. Can be MPEG1, MPEG2 or H264.

SRT status information table.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries. It is composed as follows: Card ID/Port ID.
Stream identifier.

Input Port Status. If Yes, then the Input Port associated with the record in the response is Activated. When Yes, the values of all other items in the response for the current row may be considered to be valid. When No, the values of all other items in the response for the current row may not be considered to be valid.
SRT Input Signal Lock When lock "Lock+Sig" is not yet achieved, the values of several other parameters in the record row can not be considered to be valid.
IP link status of the SRT.
IP Signal. Active indicates that signal was detected; None indicates no signal detected.
SRT input rate (Mbps).
Name of the network.
Identifier of the network.
SRT transport identifier.
SRT scrambling mode.
SRT last tune reason.
SRT tune reason.
SRT frequency tunning mode.
SRT service list mode.
SRT BAT reception.
SRT NIT reception.
SRT SDT reception.
SRT PAT reception.
Indicates signal acquisition status for this input.
Input id name. This string value is derived from the value of the stream parameter.
Current interface for the input stream for this status record.
Status of the current input record (row).

SRT current source connected. SRT URL (Uniform Resource Locator) string corresponding to specification RFC-3986. This contains the srt:// prefix plus the "Web Address" (or ipv4 address if DNS hostname resolution is not being used) plus the port number being used, plus the specified stream id (sid) string to indicate the input source stream that is being pulled. An example would be "srt://lab-1234.synamedia.com:9801/mystreamid-002".
Time stamp based Packet Delivery Delay from current SRT input (in milliseconds).
Total Lost Packets from current SRT Input.
Most recent redundancy switch reason for port switchover.
Most recent redundancy switch reason date and time.
Error packets counter.
Disaster Recovery (D/R) status.
PSI Acquisition Mode.
BISS Profile enabled of disabled for SRT.
BISS Profile value for SRT.
Transport Stream Protocol for this SRT Input Stream.
SRT send rate.
SRT receive rate.
SRT Round Trip Time (in milliseconds).
SRT Type.
SRT Remote Port.
SRT Listening Port.

Select which tables are required for service list creation.
Select how programs that are marked as encrypted --and can not be decrypted-- are handled.
This is the Input Selection for the SRT.
This is the SRT Frequency Mode.

SRT BAT reception.

This is Remote IP.

Red interface for the input stream for this status record.
BISS Profile enabled of disabled for SRT.
BISS Profile value for SRT.
This is the Command Row for the SRT.
SRT input stream latency This value represents the duration of content that is buffered to allow for re-transmission of data. It is measured in milli-seconds.
This value represents how much extra data is reserved for reliability of the SRT. It is the recovery bandwidth overhead above the input rate, measured as a percent (%).
The passphrase is the shared secret between the sender and the receiver.
This is the Source Stream ID.
SRT Redundancy Direction.
SRT Direct Redundancy Switch Over Delay.
Redundancy AV loss trigger If set, Audio/Video loss will trigger switch over.
Redundancy PMT loss trigger If set, PMT loss will trigger switch over.
Redundancy PCR loss trigger If set, PCR loss will trigger switch over.
Redundancy TS loss trigger If set, TS loss will trigger switch over.
SRT Redundancy Connection Type.
RT Redundancy Backup input stream latency This value represents the duration of content that is buffered to allow for re-transmission of data. It is measured in milli-seconds.

A unique and user-friendly key used to identify the Stream Resource.
Polling manager table provides customizable polling periods.
This is the unique key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
Name of the row.
Period defines how often to attempt to poll the row.
Default polling Interval. Defined by the developer.
Defines whether to use default or custom interval time for polling.
Time of the last poll attempt.
Status of the last poll attempt.
Additional information regarding polling status.
Polls the row regardless whether period time has elapsed.
Current state of the row.

Changes.NewFeature: Added parameter Carrier to noise ratio

Changes.Fix: Clear Fault Status Table on "No status records found" response

Changes.NewFeature: Trending and alarming enabled for Disaster Recovery parameters.
Possibility to switch between SS (Single-Stream) and MS (Multi-Stream) functionality depending on the device.

Changes.Fix: Errors present on the previous version fixed.

Changes.Change: Added parameters to be able to toggle the Web Interface protocol to either http or https

Changes.Fix: Fix XML parsing for the RF Settings (QAction 12)

Changes.Change: MOIP standalone parameters converted into Table for multiple stream support.
Changes.NewFeature: Set for channel selection, CI Setup, SDI parameter edition, Audio and Video decoding implementation
Import/Export of configuration file functionality included.

Changes.Change: add SRT and ZIXI config rtables
Add IP Setting Table write params
Polling Speed of configuration items decreased - solving heavy performance impact on device

Suppression.Reason: Write parameter does not support Exception values.
Write parameter does not support Exception values.
